admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
subsc: Roads and highways,General public administration sector
trustfund:
TF040605-ESTONIA-TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF040602-ESTONIA TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF040371-ALBANIA - SUPERVISION,
            PREPARATION OF EMERGENCY ROAD REPAIR PROJECT,TF039374-LITHUANIA - HIGHWAY,TF037007-ESTONIA - TRADE AND TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF036902-ESTONIA - TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF036751-ESTONIA - TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF036636-ESTONIA - TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF035858-ROMANIA - SECOND ROADS PROJECT,TF025247-PHRD-URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Project for Estonia aims
            to reduce road transport costs; improve road safety
            performance; strengthen road administration; and improve the
            competitiveness of trade supporting infrastructure and
            services. There are four project components. The first
            rehabilitates and upgrades portions of the
            Tallinn-Tartu-Luhamaa road and widens the Tartu Ring road
            and interchange. The second component includes the
            construction of civil works to eliminate accident black
            spots and to install road markings for new asphalt
            pavements, road side delineators, traffic signs, and
            automatic speed control cameras; creates campaign materials
            for a road safety campaign; and provides technical
            assistance, training sessions, and software. The third
            component provides continued assistance to the national road
            administration to strengthen its operational capacity and
            funds training, office, and laboratory equipment. The fourth
            component 1) facilitates trade by developing an environment
            with laws and regulations to ensure the development of trade
            supporting services and infrastructure on an equal and fair
            basis, taking into account European Union accession; 2)
            supports creation of an efficient public and private
            partnership based on combined resources; 3) encourages
            access to capital on equal terms and conditions; 4) provides
            quality education, training, and research on trade
            supporting services; and 5) provides easy Estonian access to
            global markets and foreign access to the Estonian market.
